Went on to join the fledgling RAF. Address - 11 Osgathorpe road Sheffield. From a King Edward VII newsletter Flight Lieut. Fred Ambler who had transferred from the infantry to the fledgling RAF also survived despite serving as an artillery spotter flying above the battlefields of Artois and Flanders. Ambler had captained that 1913 team (cricket) and was described as a tower of strength a wonderfully safe bat and an ecxellent captain. He played for many years in the local leagues between the wars and no doubt considered that reward enough.
Brother of John Hayes Ambler who also fell.

Further Information: DCM Citation - For conspicuous gallantry in action. Two days previously during a heavy bombardment, he dug up a buried gun and got it into action
